docs.title: KEBA KeEnergy API for Python
docs.text: A Python wrapper for the KEBA KeEnergy API used by the Web HMI.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: pip install keba-keenergy-api

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
import asyncio
from typing import Any

from keba_keenergy_api import KebaKeEnergyAPI
from keba_keenergy_api.constants import HeatCircuit
from keba_keenergy_api.constants import HeatCircuitOperatingMode

async def main():
    client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
        host="ap4400.local",
        username="test",
        password="test",
        ssl=True,
        skip_ssl_verification=True
    )

    # Get current outdoor temperature
    outdoor_temperature = await client.system.get_outdoor_temperature()

    # Get heat circuit temperature from heat circuit 2
    heat_circuit_temperature = await client.heat_circuit.get_target_temperature(
        position=2
    )

    # Read multiple values
    data = await client.read_data(
        request=[
            HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE,
            HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_DAY
        ],
        extra_attributes=True
    )

    # Enable "day" mode for heat circuit 2
    await client.heat_circuit.set_operating_mode(
        mode=HeatCircuitOperatingMode.DAY.value,
        position=2
    )

    # Write multiple values
    await client.write_data(
        request={
            # Write heat circuit on position 1 and 3
            HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_DAY: (20, None, 5),
            # Write night temperature on position 1
            HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_NIGHT: (16,),
        },
    )

asyncio.run(main())

By default, the library creates a new connection to KEBA KeEnergy API with each coroutine. If you are calling a large number of coroutines, an aiohttp ClientSession() can be used for connection pooling:

import asyncio

from keba_keenergy_api import KebaKeEnergyAPI

from aiohttp import ClientSession

async def main():
    async with ClientSession() as session:
        client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
            host="ap4400.local",
            username="test",
            password="test",
            ssl=True,
            skip_ssl_verification=True,
            session=session
        )
        ...

asyncio.run(main())

docs.title: ⚠️ Write warnings
docs.text:
This is a low-level API that allows writing values outside the safe operating range. Improper use can damage heating systems and hardware. Always check the attributes, as these may contain minimum and maximum values.

Use at your own risk!

Example:

The upper limit from the hot water tank temperature is 52 °C. Do not write larger values under any circumstances, even if it would be possible.

{
    "name": "APPL.CtrlAppl.sParam.hotWaterTank[0].param.normalSetTempMax.value",
    "attributes": {
        "dynUpperLimit": 1,
        "formatId": "fmtTemp",
        "longText": "Temp. nom.",
        "lowerLimit": "0",
        "unitId": "Temp",
        "upperLimit": "52"
    },
    "value": "50"
}

And one last warning:

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory. Be carefully!

docs.title: Donation
docs.text: I put a lot of time into this project. If you like it, you can support me with a donation.

docs.title: KebaKeEnergyAPI(host, username=None, password=None, *, ssl=False, skip_ssl_verification=False, session=None)
docs.text:
An asynchronous client to interact with KEBA KeEnergy API from the Web HMI.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION host

The hostname or IP adress e.g. ap4400.local

TYPE: str

username

Required for basic auth

TYPE: str | None DEFAULT: None

password

Required for basic auth

TYPE: str | None DEFAULT: None

ssl

Enable https schema for API URLs

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: False

skip_ssl_verification

Disable SSL verification (required for self-signed certificates)

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: False

session

Add an aiohttp client session

TYPE: ClientSession | None DEFAULT: None

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )

docs.title: device_url property
docs.text:
Get the device URL.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION str

e.g. https://ap4400.local

docs.title: read_data(request, position=None, *, human_readable=True, extra_attributes=True) async
docs.text:
Read multiple data from API with one request.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION request

Section or a list of sections e.g. [BufferTank.NAME, …]

TYPE: Section | list[Section]

position

The number of the installed devices e.g. number of buffer tanks

TYPE: Position | int | list[int] | None DEFAULT: None

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

extra_attributes

Append the extra attributes to the response

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

Examples:

>>> await client.read_data(
>>>     request=[
>>>         HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE,
>>>         HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_DAY
>>>     ]
>>> )
RETURNS DESCRIPTION dictionary

A dictionary with section as key and reponse data as value

docs.title: write_data(request) async
docs.text:
Write multiple data to API with one request.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION request

A dictionary with section as key and value to set as a tuple (first index is position 1)

TYPE: dict[Section, Any]

Examples:

>>> await client.write_data(
>>>     request={
>>>        HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_DAY: (20, None, 5),
>>>        HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_NIGHT: (16,),
>>>     }
>>> )

docs.title: filter_request(request, position=None) async
docs.text:
Return only available section that are supported by the Web HMI software version.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION request

Section or a list of sections e.g. [BufferTank.NAME, …]

TYPE: Section | list[Section]

position

The number of the installed devices e.g. number of buffer tanks

TYPE: Position | int | list[int] | None DEFAULT: None

RETURNS DESCRIPTION request

A list of sections e.g. [BufferTank.NAME, …]

Examples:

>>> data = await client.filter_request(
>>>     request=[
>>>         HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE,
>>>         HeatCircuit.TARGET_TEMPERATURE_DAY
>>>     ]
>>> )

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Added endpoint has_passive_cooling() to detect if the heat pump support passive cooling
  • Added endpoint get_compressor_use_night_speed() to get the compressor night speed state
  • Added endpoint set_compressor_use_night_speed() to get the compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint set_compressor_use_night_speed() to get the compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint get_compressor_night_speed() to get the compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint set_compressor_night_speed() to set the compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint get_max_compressor_night_speed() to get the maximum compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint get_min_compressor_night_speed() to get the minimum compressor night speed
  • Added endpoint get_flow_temperature_setpoint() to get the calculated flow temperature setpoint
  • Added endpoint get_hot_water_flow() to see if the fresh water module is activated and hot water flow
  • Added endpoint get_fresh_water_module_temperature() to get the temperature from the fresh water module
  • Added missing humanreadable values for HeatCircuitHeatRequest(), HeatCircuitOperatingMode(), and HeatPumpState()

docs.title: Get Involved
docs.text:
The KEBA KeEnergy API is an open-source project and contributions are welcome. You can:

  • Report issues or request new features
  • Improve documentation
  • Contribute code
  • Support the project by starring it on GitHub ⭐

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
Contributing to this project should be as easy and transparent as possible, whether it’s:

  • Reporting a bug
  • Discussing the current state of the code
  • Submitting a fix
  • Proposing new features

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: Set up the project with ./scripts/setup.sh.

docs.title: GitHub is used for everything
docs.text:
GitHub is used to host code, to track issues and feature requests, as well as accept pull requests.

Pull requests are the best way to propose changes to the codebase.

  1. Fork the repo and create your branch from main
  2. If you’ve changed something, update the documentation.
  3. Make sure your code lints with ./scripts/lint.sh.
  4. Test you contribution.
  5. Issue that pull request!

docs.title: Report bugs using Github’s issues
docs.text: GitHub issues are used to track public bugs. Report a bug by opening a new issue; it’s that easy!

docs.title: Write bug reports with detail, background, and sample code
docs.text:
Great Bug Reports tend to have:

  • A quick summary and/or background
  • Steps to reproduce
  • Be specific!
  • Give sample code if you can
  • What you expected would happen
  • What actually happens
  • Notes (possibly including why you think this might be happening, or stuff you tried that didn’t work)

People love thorough bug reports. I’m not even kidding.

docs.title: Use a Consistent Coding Style
docs.text:
Use black to make sure the code follows the style.

uv run black .

docs.title: Test your code modification
docs.text:
To test the code we use pytest:

uv run pytest -n auto

docs.title: License
docs.text: By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its Apache License.

docs.title: Buffer tanks
docs.text:
API Endpoints to send and retrieve the buffer tank data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.buffer_tank.get_name()

docs.title: get_name(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the buffer tank name.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION string

Buffer tank name

docs.title: get_current_top_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the current top temperature from the buffer tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_current_bottom_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the current bottom temperature from the buffer tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_operating_mode(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the operating mode from the buffer tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON) / 2 (HEAT_UP)

docs.title: set_operating_mode(mode, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the operating mode from the buffer tank.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION mode

Set the mode as integer or string (human-readable) e.g. 0 or OFF

TYPE: int | str

position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

docs.title: get_standby_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the standby temperature from the buffer tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: set_standby_temperature(temperature, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the standby temperature from the buffer tank.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION temperature

The standby temperature in °C

TYPE: float

position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

docs.title: get_target_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the target temperature from the buffer tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the buffer tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True

docs.title: get_room_humidity(position=1) async

docs.title: set_target_temperature_day(temperature, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the target temperature for the day from the heat circuit.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

The target temperature for the day in °C

position

The number of the heat circuits

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

position

docs.title: get_pump_speed(position=1) async

Get pump speed.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat circuits

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Pump speed in percent

docs.title: Heat pumps
docs.text:
API Endpoints to send and retrieve the heat pump data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.heat_pump.get_name()

docs.title: get_name(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the heat pump name.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION string

Heat pum tank name

docs.title: get_state(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the heat pump state.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

(0) STANDBY / (1) FLOW / (2) AUTO_HEAT / (3) DEFROST / (4) AUTO_COOL / (5) INFLOW / (6) PUMP_DOWN / (7) SHUTDOWN / (8) ERROR

docs.title: get_substate(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the heat pump substate.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

(0) NONE /(1) OIL_PREHEATING / (2, 3) PUMP_PRE_RUN / (4) RANDOM_DELAY / (5, 21, 22) PRESSURE_EQUALIZATION (6) DEFROST_PRE_FLOW / (7) DEFROST_MONITORING / (8) SNOW_DETECTION / (9) FLUSHING / (10) DEFROST_INITIALIZATION / (11) PREHEAT_FLOW / (12) DEFROST / (13, 25) DRIP / (14) DEFROST_END / (15, 16) OPEN / (17) COMPRESSOR_POST_RUN / (18) PUMP_POST_RUN / (19) LUBRICATION_PULSE / (20, 26) / REDUCED_SPEED / (23) COMPRESSOR_DELAY / (24) DEFROST_VENTING / (27) SWITCH_HEATING_COOLING / (28, 33) / WAIT_FOR_COMPRESSOR / (29) COMPRESSOR_STOP / (30) BIVALENT_LOCK / (31) LOCKED / (32) RETURN_FLOW_OFF / (34) MIXER_OPEN / (35) ZONE_VALVE / (36) ELECTRIC_DEFROST / (37) COUNTERFLOW_VALVE

docs.title: get_operating_mode(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

(0) OFF / (1) ON / (2) BACKUP

position

docs.title: has_source_failure(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Check if the heat pump has a source failure.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.title: has_source_actuator_failure(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Check if the heat pump has a source actuator failure.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.title: has_three_phase_failure(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Check if the heat pump has a three-phase failure.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.title: has_source_pressure_failure(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Check if the heat pump has a source pressure failure.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.title: has_vfd_failure(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Check if the heat pump has a source pressure variable frequency drive (VFD) failure.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the heat pumps

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.title: Hot water tanks
docs.text:
API Endpoints to send and retrieve the hot water tank data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.hot_water_tank.get_name()

docs.title: get_name(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the hot water tank name.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION string

Hot water tank name

docs.title: get_current_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the current temperature from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_operating_mode(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the operating mode from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

(0) OFF / (1) AUTO / (2) ON / (3) HEAT_UP

docs.title: set_operating_mode(mode, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the operating mode from the hot water tank.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION mode

Set the mode as integer or string (human-readable) e.g. 0 or OFF

TYPE: int | str

position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

docs.title: get_min_target_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the minimum target temperature from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_max_target_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the maximum target temperature from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_standby_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the standby temperature from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: set_standby_temperature(temperature, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the standby temperature from the hot water tank.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION temperature

The standby temperature in °C

TYPE: float

position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

docs.title: get_target_temperature(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the target temperature from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: set_target_temperature(temperature, position=1) async
docs.text:
Set the target temperature from the hot water tank.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION temperature

The target temperature in °C

TYPE: float

position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

docs.title: get_heat_request(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the heat request state from the hot water tank.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.text:

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

0 (OFF) / 1 (ON)

docs.text:
Get the fresh water module temperature.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_fresh_water_module_pump_speed(position=1) async
docs.text:
Get the fresh water module pump speed.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Pump speed in percent

docs.text:
Get the circulation return temperature.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the hot water tanks

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

human_readable

docs.title: Photovoltaics
docs.text:
API Endpoints to retrieve the photovoltaic data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.photovoltaics.get_excess_power()

docs.title: get_excess_power() async
docs.text:
Get excess power.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Excess power in W

docs.title: get_daily_energy() async
docs.text:
Get daily energy.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Daily energy in kWh

docs.title: get_total_energy() async
docs.text:
Get total energy.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Total energy in kWh

docs.title: Solar circuits
docs.text:
API Endpoints to send and retrieve the solar circuit data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.solar_circuit.get_name()

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

docs.title: Switch valves
docs.text:
API Endpoints to retrieve the switch valve data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.switch_valve.get_position()

docs.title: get_position(position=1, *, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get switch valve position.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION position

The number of the switch valves

TYPE: int DEFAULT: 1

human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

(0) NEUTRAL / (1) OPEN / (2) CLOSED

docs.title: System
docs.text:
API Endpoints to send and retrieve the system data.

Examples:

>>> client = KebaKeEnergyAPI(
>>>     host="ap4400.local",
>>>     username="test",
>>>     password="test",
>>>     ssl=True,
>>>     skip_ssl_verification=True
>>> )
>>> client.system.get_info()

docs.title: get_positions() async
docs.text:
Get the number of installed devices e.g. heat circuit, solar circuit, etc.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION tuple

A named tuple with the position information

docs.title: get_info() async
docs.text:
Get the system information.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION dict

A dictionary with system information

docs.title: get_hmi_info() async
docs.text:
Get the Web HMI information.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION dict

A dictionary with Web HMI information

docs.title: get_device_info() async
docs.text:
Get the control unit information.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION dict

A dictionary with control unit information

docs.title: get_number_of_heating_circuits() async
docs.text:
Get the number of heating circuits.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION int

Number of installed heating circuits

docs.title: get_outdoor_temperature() async
docs.text:
Get the outdoor temperature.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Temperature in °C

docs.title: get_operating_mode(*, human_readable=True) async
docs.text:
Get the operating mode from the system.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION human_readable

Return a human-readable string

TYPE: bool DEFAULT: True

RETURNS DESCRIPTION integer or string

-1(SETUP) / (0) STANDBY / (1) SUMMER / (2) AUTO_HEAT / (3) AUTO_COOL / (4) AUTO

docs.title: set_operating_mode(mode) async
docs.text:
Set the operating mode from the system.

Attention! Writing values should remain within normal limits, as is the case with typical use of the Web HMI. Permanent and very frequent writing of values reduces the lifetime of the built-in flash memory.

PARAMETER DESCRIPTION mode

Set the mode as integer or string (human-readable) e.g. 0 or STANDBY

TYPE: int | str

docs.title: get_cpu_usage() async
docs.text:
Get the CPU usage.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

CPU usage in percent

docs.title: get_webview_cpu_usage() async
docs.text:

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

docs.title: get_webserver_cpu_usage() async
docs.text:
Get the webserver CPU usage.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Webserver CPU usage in percent

docs.title: get_control_cpu_usage() async
docs.text:
Get the control CPU usage.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION float

Control CPU usage in percent

docs.title: get_ram_usage() async
docs.text:
Get the RAM usage.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION int

RAM usage in kilobyte

docs.title: get_free_ram() async
docs.text:
Get the free RAM.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION int

Free RAM in kilobyte.

docs.title: get_timezone() async
docs.text:
Get the timezone.

RETURNS DESCRIPTION str

Timezone as name e.g. Europe/Vienna
